newdata <- data.frame
```{r}
newdata<- data.frame(ozone = airquality$Ozone, solar = airquality$Solar.R, wind = airquality$Wind, temp = airquality$Temp)
head(newdata)
```
```{r}
plot(newdata)
```
```{r}
#correlation along with treating missing values
cor(newdata, use="pairwise.complete.obs")
```
```{r}
r.values <- cor(newdata, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")
m1 <- lm(temp ~ ozone + solar + wind, data = newdata)
summary(m1)
```
```{r}
#introducing interactions
m2 <- lm(temp ~ ozone * solar + wind, data = newdata)
summary(m2)
```
```{r}
#introducing interactions
m3 <- lm(temp ~ ozone * solar * wind, data = newdata)
summary(m3)
```
Therefor by using interactions, R-squared increased frm 0.5 to 0.57.
